thread.title: Storm in a teacup?

author: news24.com
title: Storm in a teacup?
text:
When this story broke, the impression I gained from initial news reports was that Dianne Kohler Barnard herself had said that South Africa was better off under P.W. Botha. It later transpired that she did not say this, but that she had posted a link to an article that said it.
It seems to me that the furore that followed was a bit of an over-reaction, and a failure to understand how social media work.
I quite often post links to articles that I think other people might find interesting, even if I disagree with some of the content. I sometimes post links to such articles hoping to see how other people respond before commenting on them myself. Posting a link to an article is not necessarily an endorsement of the content.
I don't know Dianne Kohler Barnard, and I'm not a supporter of the DA -- I would never consider voting for them after their "fight back" campaign against democracy in 1999. But fair's fair, and I think the treatment of Kohler Barnard isn't fair.
